intro: Alectra communis, commonly known as the common alectra, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal remedies. Alectra communis is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and its role in supporting local insect populations.
